gst.data

Class DataController

  • java.lang.Object
    • gst.data.DataController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnnotationController, SignalController, ValueController

    public abstract class DataController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller class for managing data access for SignalViews.
    Version:
    0.1.5.5 (15.10.2012)
    Author:
    Enrico Grunitz

protected DataController(UnisensDataset ds,
                         java.lang.String entryId)

        Constructs the controller object for an entry with the given ID of the dataset.
        Parameters:
        ds - dataset which contains the entry
        entryId - ID of the entry inside the dataset

    • Method Detail

      • getNumChannels

        public int getNumChannels()
        Returns the number of channels of the controlled data.
        Returns:
        number of channels

      • isAnnotation

        public boolean isAnnotation()
        Returns true if the controlled entry is annotation like.
        Returns:
        true if the data is annotation like, else false

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()
        Returns true if this entry contains read-only data.
        Returns:
        true if date entry is read-only

      • createFile

        public void createFile()
        Create the file if it not exists.

      • fileExists

        protected boolean fileExists()

      • getFile

        protected java.io.File getFile()
        Returns the file of this entry.
        Returns:
        the file of this data entry

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves the data entry to disc. Calls the saveImpl() method for the entry.

      • getEntryId

        public java.lang.String getEntryId()
        Returns:
        name of the controlled entry

      • getFullName

        public java.lang.String getFullName()
        Generates the full name of this entry. Has to be overwritten by subclasses that handle channels. Generated as Unisens + SEPERATOR + EntryId (+ SEPERATOR + Channel).
        Returns:
        the full name of this entry

      • timeOf

        protected double timeOf(long sampleStamp)
        Returns the time corresponding to the given SampleStamp. Throws a UnsupportedOperationException if the entry is not an instance of org.unisens.TimedEntry.
        Parameters:
        sampleStamp - the sampleStamp to convert.
        Returns:
        the time in seconds of this sample stamp

      • lowSampleStamp

        protected long lowSampleStamp(double time)
        Returns the highest samplestamp that is lower or equal the given point in time. Only works for entries of org.unisens.TimedEntry.
        Parameters:
        time - point in time to convert
        Returns:
        samplestamp lower or equal the given time

      • roundSampleStamp

        protected long roundSampleStamp(double time)
        Returns the closest sample-stamp to the given point in time. Only works for entries of org.unisens.TimedEntry.
        Parameters:
        time - to convert into sample-stamp
        Returns:
        the sample-stamp closest to the given point in time

      • highSampleStamp

        protected long highSampleStamp(double time)
        Returns the lowest samplestamp that is higher or equal the given point in time. Only works for entries of org.unisens.TimedEntry.
        Parameters:
        time - point in time to convert
        Returns:
        samplestamp higher or equal the given time

      • getChannelName

        public abstract java.lang.String getChannelName()
        Returns the name of the channel of the controllers entry. Returns null if the channel is not named.
        Returns:
        channel name

      • getPreferredColor

        public java.awt.Color getPreferredColor()
        Returns:
        prefColor

      • setSource

        public void setSource(java.lang.String source,
             java.lang.String sourceId)
        Sets the source and sourceId fields of the controlled dataset entry to the given Strings.
        Parameters:
        source - the source String
        sourceId - the sourceId String

      • setPreferredColor

        public void setPreferredColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the preferred color for this data.
        Parameters:
        color - the new color
        Throws:
        {@code - NullPointerException} if color is null

      • notifyListeners

        protected void notifyListeners(DataController source)
        Notifies all registered Listeners of changed data. Has to be called by subclasses.
        Parameters:
        source - the DataController thats data changed

      • register

        public void register(DataChangeListener dcl)
        Registers the given DataChangeListener to this controller.
        Parameters:
        dcl - the DataChangeListener to notify about changes

      • remove

        public void remove(DataChangeListener dcl)
        Removes the DataChangeListener from the notification list.
        Parameters:
        dcl - DataChangeListener to remove

      • getAnnotations

        public abstract AnnotationList getAnnotations(double startTime,
                            double endTime)
        Returns a List of the annotations of controlled Entry. All annotations are between startTime and endTime. If the entry doesn't has annotations null is returned.
        Parameters:
        startTime - beginning time
        endTime - ending time
        Returns:
        list of annotations or null

      • getDataPoints

        public abstract org.jfree.data.xy.XYSeries getDataPoints(double startTime,
                                       double endTime,
                                       int maxPoints)
        Returns the data points as an XYSeries. All data points are between startTime and endTime.
        Parameters:
        startTime - beginning time
        endTime - ending time
        maxPoints - number of maximum data points
        Returns:
        the array of data points or null if there are only annotations

      • getMaxX

        public abstract double getMaxX()
        Gives the time in seconds of the last measured data point.
        Returns:
        time in seconds

      • getMinX

        public abstract double getMinX()
        Gives the time in seconds of the first measured data point.
        Returns:
        time in seconds

      • getPhysicalUnit

        public abstract java.lang.String getPhysicalUnit()
        Returns the string that specifies the physical unit of the acquired variables.
        Returns:
        physical unit as String

      • setPhysicalUnit

        public abstract void setPhysicalUnit(java.lang.String physUnit)
        Sets the physical unit specifying string. Ignored if not applicable.

      • saveImpl

        protected abstract void saveImpl()
        This function saves the data to its corresponding file. Called if isBuffered is set to true.
